stories.text:
I received an email from Google Fi this week. Google claims that I have used too much international data roaming (I typically use around 1gb per month) and have not used the service in the US enough, according to the latest terms & conditions update. I have read through the latest terms & conditions, the acceptable use policy, etc. - and there is nothing specifically stated about this. So, if you are also a Google Fi subscriber and not in the US 100% of the time - be aware, and you may want to consider seeking alternatives soon.

Given how Google tends to kill products/services on a whim, I guess I should have expected something like this at some point. For some reason, as a 5+ year paying customer, owner of multiple generations of Google(Pixel) phones, etc., I didn't expect to be blocked with only a 30 day notice. The lack of transparency, proactive communication, and overall terrible customer experience is making me think hard about subscribing to anything from Google again after this.
stories.title: Google Fi is blocking frequent travelers and expats
Truckers in France are starting to prepare for a freedom Convoy
Neil Young’s Spotify Protest Isn’t Censorship, It’s Exercising His Free Market

stories.text:
How HN can better live up to the aspirational "On-Topic" guidelines: Nuke every thread that reaches ~2e+2 comments, no exceptions.

This is based on the logic that nothing intellectual appeals to all that many people. Intellects vary too much. Search your feelings. You know it to be true.

And hey, there are no ads anyway, so what's the downside?
stories.title: A modest proposal for improving HN
